meanings.sent1: The taut rope held the swing securely.
meanings.sent2: Her taut muscles showed her strength.
meanings.sent3: The taut drum made a loud noise when struck.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was as taut as a bowstring.
meanings.sent5: The taut sail billowed in the wind, propelling the boat forward.

meanings.sent1: His taut expression revealed his worry.
meanings.sent2: The taut wire fence kept the animals out.
meanings.sent3: The taut situation made everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent4: Her taut nerves felt like piano wires ready to snap.
meanings.sent5: The taut mask on his face hid his true emotions.

meanings.definition: To make something tight or tense
meanings.sent1: She tauts the strings of her guitar before playing.
meanings.sent2: He tauts the canvas before starting to paint.
meanings.sent3: The magician tauts the rope before his daring escape act.
meanings.sent4: The chef tauts the dough to prepare it for baking.
meanings.sent5: The athlete tauts his shoelaces before the race to avoid tripping.
